item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "What art seeks to disturb is monotony of type, slavery of custom, tyranny of habit, and the reduction of man to the level of a machine." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "What the public criticizes in you, cultivate. It is you." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "The brain is wider than the sky, For, put them side by side, The one the other will include With ease, and you beside." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Georgia O'Keeffe
item.description: "Nobody sees a flower - really - it is so small it takes time - we haven't time - and to see takes time, like to have a friend takes time." -- Georgia O'Keeffe

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "When we see others as the enemy, we risk becoming what we hate. When we oppress others, we end up oppressing ourselves. All of our humanity is dependent upon recognizing the humanity in others." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "The strongest principle of growth lies in human choice." -- George Eliot

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by W.S. Merwin
item.description: "Poetry is like making a joke. If you get one word wrong at the end of a joke, you've lost the whole thing." -- W.S. Merwin

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "We read deeply for varied reasons, most of them familiar: that we cannot know enough people profoundly enough; that we need to know ourselves better; that we require knowledge, not just of self and others, but of the way things are. Yet the strongest, most authentic motive for deep readingâ€¦is the search for a difficult pleasure." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "I discovered that I am tired of being a person. Not just tired of being the person I was, but any person at all" -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "What matters in literature in the end is surely the idiosyncratic, the individual, the flavor or the color of a particular human suffering. " -- Harold Bloom

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Charlie Parker
item.description: "Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn. They teach you that music has boundaries. But, man, there's no boundary line to art." -- Charlie Parker

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Your sacred space is where you can find yourself over and over again." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description:
"The only interesting answers are those which destroy the questions.
" -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I am circling around God, around the ancient tower, and I have been circling for a thousand years, and I still don't know if I am a falcon, or a storm, or a great song." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "I am burning myself up and will always do so." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Although a skillful flatterer is a most delightful companion if you have him all to yourself, his taste becomes very doubtful when he takes to complimenting other people." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by W.S. Merwin
item.description: "My words are the garment of what I shall never be Like the tucked sleeve of a one-armed boy." -- W.S. Merwin

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Federico GarcÃ­a Lorca
item.description: "Verde que te quiero verde" -- Federico GarcÃ­a Lorca

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "I have known the joy and pain of friendship. I have served and been served. I have made some good enemies for which I am not a bit sorry. I have loved unselfishly, and I have fondled hatred with the red-hot tongs of Hell. That's living." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "We are here to awaken from our illusion of separateness." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "We often think of peace as the absence of war, that if powerful countries would reduce their weapon arsenals, we could have peace. But if we look deeply into the weapons, we see our own minds- our own prejudices, fears and ignorance. Even if we transport all the bombs to the moon, the roots of war and the roots of bombs are still there, in our hearts and minds, and sooner or later we will make new bombs. To work for peace is to uproot war from ourselves and from the hearts of men and women. To prepare for war, to give millions of men and women the opportunity to practice killing day and night in their hearts, is to plant millions of seeds of violence, anger, frustration, and fear that will be passed on for generations to come. " -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "To photograph people is to violate them, by seeing them as they never see themselves, by having knowledge of them that they can never have; it turns people into objects that can be symbolically possessed. Just as a camera is a sublimation of the gun, to photograph someone is a subliminal murder - a soft murder, appropriate to a sad, frightened time." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by ZORA NEALE HURSTON
item.description: "Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How <i>can</i> any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? Itâ€™s beyond me." -- ZORA NEALE HURSTON

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "If a poet has a dream, it is not of becoming famous, but of being believed." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Tammy Marie add a quote by Gwendolyn Brooks
item.description: "One reason that cats are happier than people is that they have no newspapers." -- Gwendolyn Brooks
